verses.roman:
nedur dundubhayo vyomni
vavṛṣuḥ kusumair mudā
gandharvā munayo rāmaṁ
tad-vīryair īḍire tadā

synonyms: neduḥ—resounded; dundubhayaḥ—kettledrums; vyomni—in the sky; vavṛṣuḥ—rained down; kusumaiḥ—with flowers; mudā—with joy; gandharvāḥ—the Gandharvas; munayaḥ—the great sages; rāmam—Lord Balarāma; tat-vīryaiḥ—with His heroic deeds; īḍire—praised; tadā—then.
translation: At that time kettledrums resounded in the sky, the Gandharvas joyfully rained down flowers, and the great sages praised Lord Balarāma's heroic deeds.
